name: MDsrv
body:
**MDsrv** is a tool to stream trajectories of molecular coordinates and
show them interactively within a web browser. With that, Molecular Dynamics
(MD) trajectories can be served within a local network to co-workers or
over the Internet to colleagues all over the world.

MDsrv is a tool to show molecular dynamics trajectories on-line using a web
server that provides fast access to MD trajectories and a web application
to view them. To allow meaningful display of raw datasets processing options
for centering, superposition and handling of periodic boundaries are included.
Further, the MD trajectories can be filtered on-the-fly to sub-sets of
atoms and coarse time-resolutions. The resulting molecular-visualization
web application displays large molecular structures and animates their
MD trajectories to allow interactive exploration and collaborative visual
analysis within a local network or over the Internet.

An example of the usage of MDsrv in combination with the NGL viewer can
be found here: [MDsrv-example](http://proteinformatics.charite.de/MDsrv-example)


Read more:

* [installation quick start](installation_quick_start.html)
* [usage example](basic_example.html)
* [citations](citations.html)


### Availability

All source code is available under the
[MIT License](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) from
[github.com/arose/mdsrv](https://github.com/arose/mdsrv) and the Python
Package index
[pypi.python.org/pypi/mdsrv](http://pypi.python.org/pypi/mdsrv).

### Participating

Ask your **questions** to alexander.rose@weirdbyte.de.

Please report **bugs** or **enhancement requests** through the [Issue
Tracker]({{site.github.issues}}). 

MDsrv is **open source** and welcomes *your* contributions. [Fork
the repository on
GitHub](https://github.com/arose/mdsrv#fork-destination-box)
and submit a pull request.
